channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Yellow lines were painted and there is a gap, 25th September
item.description:
Yellow lines were painted a few weeks ago and a gap was left in the middle of them, I assume because a car was parked there. I'd appreciate it if they could be finished. As you can see from the photo people are parking there. I can put bollards in the gap if you leave 3 at 1 Rowanwood ave.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 70, 72, Rowanwood Avenue, Blackfen, Sidcup, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree brushing up against our house, 25th September
item.description:
Hi there, there is a beautiful magnolia tree outside our house and the neighbours and it has grown so big that it’s now constantly brushing up against our house, causing phone lines to go taught and appearing imminently about to break and generally obstructing the pavement. I am also worried that due to its size, there is a risk of subsidence to our house as this has been a common problem with similar trees on our road. Please could you come and prune the tree to a more reasonable size.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Douglas Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Obstruction - Overgrown / overhanging private tree / hedge

item.title: Crystal Palace Parade SE19 about ten yards north from, 25th September
item.description:
Crystal Palace Parade SE19 about ten yards north from streetlight ID number C115#1 is black box (type normally controls traffic lights) which is tagged – see Google Streetview which shows streetlight and said box: https://www.google.com/maps/@51.4201154,-0.0783354,3a,66.8y,82.14h,81.85t/data=!3m8!1e1!3m6!1sBLijSqThFsFb7AR06mMTcw!2e0!5s20250401T000000!6shttps:%2F%2Fstreetviewpixels-pa.googleapis.com%2Fv1%2Fthumbnail%3Fcb_client%3Dmaps_sv.tactile%26w%3D900%26h%3D600%26pitch%3D8.145914655478919%26panoid%3DBLijSqThFsFb7AR06mMTcw%26yaw%3D82.13716519933509!7i16384!8i8192?authuser=0&entry=ttu&g_ep=EgoyMDI1MDkyMi4wIKXMDSoASAFQAw%3D%3D (This has been tagged in the past and I put a picture on this old completed report: https://fix.bromley.gov.uk/report/7806511)
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Crystal Palace Parade, Crystal Palace, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Crystal Palace Parade SE19 two plastic yellow grit bins, 25th September
item.description:
Crystal Palace Parade SE19 at north end of bus terminus is a set of pedestrian crossing lights with a black box (between streetlight pole numbers 6 & 9 I believe). Adjacent to said black box are two plastic yellow grit bins which are bob graffiti tagged. Google Streetview: https://www.google.com/maps/@51.4213245,-0.0777554,3a,75y,118.24h,88.21t/data=!3m8!1e1!3m6!1s1cu6jJF9lAv_Rc7ccjyC3A!2e0!5s20250401T000000!6shttps:%2F%2Fstreetviewpixels-pa.googleapis.com%2Fv1%2Fthumbnail%3Fcb_client%3Dmaps_sv.tactile%26w%3D900%26h%3D600%26pitch%3D1.7920879128430016%26panoid%3D1cu6jJF9lAv_Rc7ccjyC3A%26yaw%3D118.23643147340617!7i16384!8i8192?authuser=0&entry=ttu&g_ep=EgoyMDI1MDkyMi4wIKXMDSoASAFQAw%3D%3D
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Crystal Palace Parade, Crystal Palace, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Crystal Palace Parade SE19 on green hoarding a bit, 25th September
item.description:
Crystal Palace Parade SE19 on green hoarding a bit north of the bus terminus with ‘Crystal Palace High Level Station’ or similar on it is graffiti tagged. This is between to streetlight column ID numbered C115#11 and 13.
